titleInfo.title: Photograph taken on airstrip in Belgium, 1944

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Photograph of a snow scene at a German airstrip near Gosselies, Belgium, that had been taken over by Americans during the Second World War. American GI's lived in the tent on the right with only a heater stove to keep warm. The camouflage nets hanging down from above are German. Military vehicles are parked amongst the snow. A Belgian village is visible in the distance atop the hill. Shortly after the Americans took over the base, a grisly discovery of a mass grave was found in the middle of the airstrip, where Germans had executed Belgian civilians. Joe Thompson Jr., a Nashville native, served in the Army Air Corps in the 109th Tactical Reconnaissance Squadron of the 9th Air Force in Europe during World War II. He took numerous photographs during his off-duty time. Forms part of the Veterans History Project. 1 photograph negative: b & w ; 120 mm

titleInfo.title: Veterans History Project Collection, World War II Series, Joe Thompson Jr. Papers
